title: ‘Clarkson clause’ could waive planning permission for farm shops
description: Rishi Sunak will allow farmers to open shops, offices and other rural businesses without full planning permission in a Clarkson-inspired pitch to rural voters. The prime minister is also promising more robots to help with planting and harvesting to reduce ...

title: PM announces support for farming amid industry 'crisis'
description: The prime minister will announce a package of measures on Tuesday to help farmers - but many say more is needed to support an industry "in crisis". Rishi Sunak will use a speech at Tuesday's National Farmers Union annual conference to outline government plans to boost the UK's food security.

title: Cost of living fears rife in election battleground

title: Tories accused of failing parents as cost of childcare rises faster than inflation
description: Analysis by the Labour Party shows the price of a part-time nursery place has jumped from £82 per week in 2010 to £146 now.

title: Fruit-picking robots could slash the need for migrant labour, Rishi Sunak to tell farmers as he unveils £220 million fund for new technology
description: Fruit-picking robots could slash the need for migrant labour, Rishi Sunak will tell farmers today. Addressing the National Farmers' Union conference, the Prime Minister will unveil a £220 million fund to help deploy new technology to help boost ...

title: Rishi Sunak’s GB News appearance probed by Ofcom after 500 complaints
description: Ofcom said the so-called People’s Forum garnered around 500 complaints and it was investigating the show under its impartiality rules

title: Sunak bids to win back support of British farmers

title: Ofcom to investigate GB News show featuring Rishi Sunak
description: Ofcom has launched an investigation into a GB News programme which featured Prime Minister Rishi Sunak. In a statement, the UK's communications and broadcast regulator said: "We have received around 500 complaints about the programme which aired on GB News on 12 February 2024".

title: PM to tell farming conference Government is ‘by their side’
description: Rishi Sunak is set to pledge he will “never take our food security for granted” as he outlines support for farmers in a speech to the sector. Speaking to the National Farmers’ Union conference on Tuesday, the Prime Minister is expected to say the ...

title: 'We'll never take food security for granted' promises Sunak, as farming chief warns it risks becoming 'poor relation' to other priorities
description: NFU chief Minette Batters says the next government needs to treat farming "as one vital part of our national infrastructure". Political parties are attending the NFU conference as they seek to win the rural vote ahead of the general election.

title: ‘Clarkson clause’ could waive planning permission for farm shops

title: Rishi Sunak will confirm Government plans to slash farming red tape and boost technology

title: Post-Brexit deal with EU border agency boosts ‘stop the boats’ plan
description: Agreement means Border Force officers will be able to get live intelligence mapping of migrant movements across EU borders

title: Labour’s triple-lock pension pledge will force the Tories to do the same

description: Keir Starmer is planning to keep the policy if he becomes PM, amid fears over pensioner poverty in housing crisis

title: Former minister Tobias Ellwood calls for new legislation to stop protesters visiting MPs' houses
description: Tobias Ellwood has called for new laws amid suggestions from Just Stop Oil that it plans to target MPs' houses in the run-up to the next election.

title: Henry Staunton: Former Post Office chairman investigated over bullying before dismissal, business secretary claims
description: Kemi Badenoch has said former Post Office chair Henry Staunton was being investigated over bullying allegations before his dismissal - as she accused him of seeking revenge against the government.

title: Rishi Sunak: I know it's been tough, but our plan will boost Britain
description: Rishi Sunak vowed he will give Britain a renewed sense of pride after the “tough times” the country has been through. The Prime Minister admitted the last few years have not been easy but insisted the future is bright under his plan to turn the economy around.

title: Right to describe Navalny’s death as ‘murder’, minister says
description: Alicia Kearns, the Foreign Affairs Committee chairwoman, had urged MPs to call out Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny’s death as murder.

title: Wellingborough's new Labour MP takes her seat in Parliament
description: The new Labour MP for Wellingborough in Northamptonshire has taken her seat in the House of Commons. Gen Kitchen overturned an 18,540 majority in the seat previously held by Peter Bone, who was ousted following a recall petition. Ms Kitchen recited the Parliamentary Oath and shook the Speaker's hand.

title: Donald Trump breaks silence on Alexei Navalny's death - but makes no mention of Vladimir Putin
description: Donald Trump has broken his silence on the death of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny - but avoided casting blame on President Vladimir Putin.

title: UK court convicts small boat pilot of migrant deaths in Channel
description: A man who piloted an “unseaworthy” boat across the English Channel was found guilty Monday of the manslaughter of four migrants who drowned during the crossing.
